title: What am I supposed to do?
body:
Playing ranked by yourself is essentially gambling, its sheer luck as to wether you get people who are competent or people who clearly aren't. and when they aren't its just so frustrating, I don't ask for them to be good, not at all.  i just ask for them to know better than to jump into a 1v5 as Rek'sai the whole game, if you can play with friends who you know are competent, its pointless to go solo.

The solution then **IS** to play with my friends, who I know are good, the problem is that I'm s5 and they're b3 b3 and b1 (which is weird because they are probably better than me) 

but when I play with them, whenever we win, i gain like 10 LP and lose 20 on a loss, (and ranked is basically 50/50 anyway) so I end up going down even though we win slightly more games than we lose. 

So just what am i supposed to do? The system is self destructive...

This is why i just give rank a miss all together

Yeah it's basically gotten to the point where unless you know people at your rank that are actually are decent and deserve to climb, your gambling as to actually being able to climb or not.

Ranked is basically 0 impact if you play by yourself and are on and against a team with premades.

Persevere, don't give up, play more games regardless of your rank gain or loss. Pay no attention to whether or not you're climbing and just playyyy. Focus on what you can improve whether it's team fighting, compositions or map awareness.  Simply playing more ranked games will give you more experience and you will climb eventually. You can't really sit around expecting match making to magically improve or that the game suddenly give you a better team. 

There are a lot of challenger, diamond, platinum, and gold players who felt like they were in elo hell, and were in that state of mind for a long time. They climbed the same way we are trying to climb with trolls, bad players, you name it, feeding their own asses off, they've endured it. It's the simple concept of you play more, you get better and understand the game more as you go. 

You see it all the time in smurf accounts on where someone from a higher rank comes back and levels up their account to 30 and climbs from bronze. It's not because they're high almighty gods of playing League because even platinum and gold players are bad at times. It's because they know something that we don't. They don't always get good teams in bronze, they should statistically get the same teams that we do, yet we can't climb and they can.

Here's the way I see it (using your analogy):

+ _Ranked is a coin toss, but your ability and skill as a player rigs the toss._ 

 A good player might only get heads (win) 55% of the time, whereas a bad player might only get heads 40% of the time.

If you look at it game by game, the bad player will win some tosses (games) that he shouldn't have. But in the **long run** he'll loose too much and de-rank because the odds are stacked against him. 

The opposite applies for the good player. He'll rank up over time because the odds are in his favour.
Except your not taking it into account, that the other players in the game (specifically the premades) have a lot more effect on the coin toss then you as the solo player do.

It's dependent on skill. Say if **Faker** played in Bronze, his coin toss would be almost 99% heads. He'd have a huge impact on the outcome of each toss.

The less effect you are able to have on the coin toss, the closer you are to your deserved rank.

> So with a 4 man premade on each team, your telling me that realistically if you don't deserve to be higher, you will get a 50% win rate?

Yeah you should "stabilize" at a certain rank with close to 50% overall winrate. Your chance of winning each individual game will vary of course, but overall you'll balance out at 50% until you improve. 

That is however ignoring factors such as tilt and frustration. I know many players who fluctuate ranks often because they tilt hard and then start winning again.

Except with the huge amount of premades you will run into, you will basically default to a 50% win rate.

You want to argue that it's stabilising at the rank you belong at, but that simply isn't true.

Hold up. I'm not understanding here XD

_Why do you default to a 50% winrate against premades?_

I know premades are balanced (through MMR penalties) to have a 50% winrate. But if your actual skill is **higher** than your MMR, then you should still stomp on the premades, right?

The premade you're matched with will have a 50% winrate against players who have your MMR. If you're **better** than your MMR, then you'll climb, even against premades.

>I know premades are balanced (through MMR penalties) to have a 50% winrate.

So when your solo, with 4 and against a solo and 4, your balanced to have 50% win rate, and won't have basically any influence on the game because the game is decided by that 4v4 not the solo players.

Oh, I think I agree a bit in this situation then. I actually sent **Riot** a document that outlined all the issues with dynamic queue, and what you mentioned was one of them. (I can link it if you want to see BTW)

I don't believe it happens as often as you say though, or has such a large impact. 

I would say the ranked system is tarnished by situations like this. But I find it a bit hard to conclude that it's really broken or not working properly at all.

>I don't believe it happens as often as you say though, or has such a large impact.

I'm not saying it happens a large amount, it just can remove and climbing for anyone that is relatively close to their ranked position.

For example you could be winning 53ish% of your Solo V Solo games where this doesn't happen, but your going to run into enough games that push that back down to 50% that your 3% climbing rate doesn't really mean much at all.

Yeah, I'm in agreement here now :D

Although I think the [change](https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/4ychi5/possibly_new_ranked_format_for_season_7/) Riot has planned for Season 7 might pretty much fix this. 

The current issue with this is "4 man dilemma" that DQ players may be getting extra ranks and solo players may be loosing ranks. If you split the queues then everyone is in the same boat.

Solo players will no longer have competitive disadvantage against their ranked peers, because their ranked peers will all be solo players.
My problem with that is that unless they have separate Queues, this change means nothing, except making people who play in premades have more shit said to them then the emblem currently causes.
